comment: Output would be 1 loop only iterate once
after breaking from the if code block why didnt the value of i incremented ,for loop was still going on
mystock = 0 for s in range (5, 11, 2):     mystock += s     if mystock == 11:         break         mystock +=1 print(mystock)  output 21
break statement brings the control out of a loop(for or while) not from the condition itself. The whole loop is terminated.
mystock = 0 for s in range (5, 11, 2):     mystock += s     if mystock == 12:         break         mystock +=1 print(mystock)  output 12

@muthabukujohn5089  yeah, makes sense, because in the  first set you never get to 11 for the if-statement to become True (5 plus 7 equals 12), so it will continue with the next in range which is 9, which then adds it to the 12, equaling 21.. in the second attempt you changed it to 12, which makes the if-statement True, so it will break out of the statement and print 12
